thread.title: Leicester City sack Claudio Ranieri less than 10 months after winning unlikely Premier League title
thread.title_full: Leicester City sack Claudio Ranieri less than 10 months after winning unlikely Premier League title

author: Richard Parry
title: Leicester City sack Claudio Ranieri less than 10 months after winning unlikely Premier League title
text:
Thursday 23 February 2017 20:28 GMT Click to followES Sport Gone | Leicester City sack Ranieri Getty Images 
Leicester City have sacked manager Claudio Ranieri less than 10 months after he guided them to the top of English football. 
But as glorious as last season was for the Foxes, not even the subsequent excited of Champions League football has curtailed what has been a disastrous defence of their Premier League title. 
Leicester currently sit just one point above the relegation zone , having failed to win in the Premier League since the 1-0 victory at home to West Ham on December 31. 
And it’s that domestic demise, in which they have failed to score or win in the top flight in 2017, that has sealed Ranieri’s fate, despite the 65-year-old having a received a vote of confidence from the club a fortnight ago. 
The club have confirmed that assistant manager Craig Shakespeare and first team Coach Mike Stowell will take charge or first team affairs until a new manager is appointed, and are set to be in the Leicester dugout for this weekend's match with Liverpool. In Pictures: Leicester City's title party In Pictures: Leicester City's title party 1/12 
A general view of the celebration stage during the Leicester City celebrations. Alex Pantling/Getty Images 
The Buses carrying the Leicester squad and trophy makes it's way through the crowded streets. Michael Regan/Getty Images 
The Buses carrying the Leicester squad and trophy makes it's way through the crowded streets. Michael Regan/Getty Images 4/12 
Leicester players look on as thousands descend on the city to take part in the club's title celebrations. Michael Regan/Getty Images 
The Buses carrying the Leicester squad and trophy makes it's way through the crowded streets. Michael Regan/Getty Images 6/12 
Young fans gather on the streets prior to the Leicester City's bus parade, equipped with Claudio Ranieri masks. Michael Regan/Getty Images 
Claudio Ranieri with captain Wes Morgan. Laurence Griffiths/Getty Images 
Claudio Ranieri and Vichai Srivaddhanaprabha, the club owner, show off the Premier League trophy. Laurence Griffiths/Getty Images 
Fans celebrate as Kasabian play a live set. Laurence Griffiths/Getty Images 
Fans celebrate as Kasabian play a live set following the Foxes title victory. Laurence Griffiths/Getty Images
